image.altText: Two pedestrians walking northbound across a three-lane road bridge with a pedestrian path over a lake.

props.synopsis: Loneliness is rising faster among Canberra adults in their 30s and 40s, with new research showing this cohort has now overtaken younger people as the most socially isolated in the ACT.

title.children: Midlife loneliness on the rise in Canberra as financial pressures bite

image.altText: Two uniformed police officers stand in tall yellow grass next to a badly damaged motorcycle caught in a chicken wire fence.

props.synopsis: A 57-year-old Canberra man dies after losing control and colliding with a tree on Tidbinbilla Road. His death is the ACT's fifth road fatality this year.

title.children: Police allegedly saw group of motorcyclists speeding before fatal crash

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly "stormed a home" and threatened a mother and son with a taser while demanding prescription drugs and cash will remain in custody.

title.children: Man allegedly 'stormed home' armed with taser and threatened mother and son

image.altText: A teenage boy holding a softball bat and glove, looking sad.

props.synopsis: It was a schoolyard sport so common it once rivalled cricket as the most popular in Australia. But now grassroots teams are struggling to fill a team sheet.

title.children: Australia were world champs, now teams are scrambling for players

image.altText: Chenice Jordan

props.synopsis: Female participation in rugby league across the Canberra region has reached a record high. Despite this, both women's teams in Queanbeyan have been forced to fold mid-season due to a player shortage.

title.children: The footy club with a $600,000 female change room but no women's team

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue blazer.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC under a freedom of information request reveal that a complaint about Leanne Castley was formally lodged on June 25, though it was later withdrawn.

title.children: Complaint lodged then withdrawn against ACT Opposition Leader

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist?

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: Bridget McKenzie asks a question at Senate Estimates.

props.synopsis: Nationals senator Bridget McKenzie has grilled department officials this morning about what Transport Minister Catherine King is doing to stop driving instructor sexual assaults. Follow live.

title.children: 'Actually do something': Senator urges government to act on driving instructor assaults

image.altText: Sam Flanders of the Gold Coast Suns is tackled by Liam Henry of St Kilda.

props.synopsis: Sam Flanders makes the move to St Kilda in exchange for a draft pick, Adelaide pulls out of the race to sign Clayton Oliver, while Carlton makes the first official move of the trade period. Follow live.

title.children: Saints and Suns reach agreement on Flanders deal as Blues nab big man

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Bombers looking to move up this year's draft to pick Willem Duursma
Essendon says 'nothing's changed' on its Zach Merrett stance
Saints and Suns reach agreement on Sam Flanders deal

image.altText: Two woman stand in a burnt building with masks on

props.synopsis: Amid more extreme weather events, parametric insurance — described as a bet on the weather —is on the rise. It is now being touted as a possible solution for Australians, who have some of the highest insurance losses in the world.

title.children: Betting on the weather emerges as a solution as insurance costs skyrocket

image.altText: a man standing out the front of a house holding nrl teams bulldog flags

props.synopsis: Artemios Mintzas, 60, will appear in a Sydney court charged over an alleged shooting spree that shut down an inner-west suburb for about two hours on Sunday night.

title.children: Alleged Croydon Park gunman charged with 25 offences

image.altText: a man in a dark jacket walks through a brown crop

props.synopsis: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam.

title.children: German chemical giant to release Roundup alternative in Australia

image.altText: Sebastien Lecornu and Emmanual Macron in navy suits turned towards each other, standing besides the French and EU flag.

props.synopsis: The sudden resignation of France's prime minister — the country's fifth in two years — has put President Emmanuel Macron in a bind.

title.children: Why has France gone through five prime ministers in two years?

image.altText: The supermoon as it rises over Mt Coot-tha in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Our skies will be graced by up to four consecutive supermoons over the next months. Here's why they happen, and how we can end up with multiple supermoons in a row.

title.children: A trifecta of supermoons starts with tonight's harvest moon

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a pink blouse sitting on a couch in a TV studio

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman who claims to be Madeleine McCann is on trial charged with stalking the missing child's parents over the past three years.

title.children: Woman claiming to be Madeleine McCann faces court

image.altText: A man stands with his hands folded together under a mango tree and stares forward.

props.synopsis: Farmers are close to abandoning the dream of a food bowl in northern Australia, as one expert warns the region is nearing its "thermal limits" for cropping and cattle.

title.children: Farmer says northern food bowl a 'pipe dream' amid changing climate

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: Local share markets have opened lower after a mixed night on Wall Street, as the US government shutdown continues.  Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Gold hits record high, local markets open lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ANZ-Indeed job ads fall 3.3% in September, signalling possibility of rising unemployment
Auction clearance rate nudges higher despite long weekend disruptions
Consumer sentiment sinks back to six-month low

image.altText: A vast waterway from above

props.synopsis: The floodwaters which have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

title.children: Floodwaters 'transform whole desert' as Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre reaches peak

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and a blue shirt standing in a Melbourne laneway

props.synopsis: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

title.children: GP says fees will go up at his clinic when bulk-billing incentives come in

image.altText: A firefighter carries a hiker out on his back in the dark, with a group of people using head torches.

props.synopsis: Villagers have joined rescue crews in attempting to save those who have become stuck in heavy snow on Mount Everest in Tibet.

title.children: Hundreds of hikers still missing after Mount Everest blizzard

image.altText: Erica rests her head on her palm as she looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: With the help of Mystery Road: Origin's steely detective Jay Swan, an all-Indigenous writing team tackles one of Australia's biggest issues.

title.children: Mystery Road: Origin screenwriter Erica Glynn has only ever written with mob

image.altText: LeBron James sits across from an interviewer on a basketball court.

props.synopsis: LeBron James throws the NBA world into a frenzy with a 10-second video that has people speculating about his retirement or a possible bait-and-switch.

title.children: LeBron James teases 'Second Decision', prompting retirement speculation

image.altText: An aerial shot of a construction site near the ocean's edge, cranes can be seen below.

props.synopsis: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

title.children: Ship lift project dubbed 'one of the biggest blowouts' in Australia

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: Dozens of birds on the sand next to waves at a beach.

props.synopsis: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing after admitting he camped beyond the boundary line whilst visiting privately owned Robbins Island to observe migratory birds.

title.children: Renowned photographer tried to avoid trespass by staying below high-tide mark

image.altText: A player looks to pass a ball while playing in front of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: AC Milan will host a Serie A match in Perth next year, as UEFA's hand appears to have been forced to allow the game to go ahead.

title.children: UEFA makes 'regrettable' decision to allow Italian Serie A match in Perth

image.altText: A woman sits a court deck.

props.synopsis: Less than a year after the landmark trial which shook the world, Gisèle Pelicot will once again brave a courtroom as one of her rapists appeals his sentence.

title.children: Gisèle Pelicot to face rapist once again in French appeals case

image.altText: An image of an elderly man in a hat playing a guitar.

props.synopsis: Mounted crews and drones are now involved in the search for Peter Willoughby, 76, who became disoriented and walked off into dense bushland near Launceston, police say.

title.children: Second time in a week police have gone to aid of missing 76yo

image.altText: Col Blanch standing in front of a building speaking.

props.synopsis: A radicalisation expert warns a crackdown on gun-owning "sovereign citizens" in Western Australia risks further entrenching extremist views in an already disenfranchised group.

title.children: Fears gun raids on sovereign citizens could raise threat level

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: Users have reported Facebook's AI search has shown incorrect information about four-year-old Gus who remains missing in SA's outback.

title.children: Expert cautions AI use as it gives misinformation about missing SA boy

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Doxed man petitions to have sovereign citizens declared domestic terrorists

image.altText: Firefighters battling urban bushfire

props.synopsis: New Australian research shows, globally, major bushfire events are becoming more frequent, fatal and economically damaging.

title.children: Australia's south coast 'very, very high risk' for bushfires, modelling shows

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Epstein and Maxwell, urging peole to call if they have been a victim, is pointed to.

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court declines to hear Ghislaine Maxwell's bid to overturn her conviction for helping the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sexually abuse teenage girls.

title.children: US court declines Ghislaine Maxwell appeal against sex trafficking conviction

image.altText: Two forensic detectives in body suits, photographing a car and glass on a street.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives are investigating the discovery of a man's body on the New South Wales far south coast overnight.

title.children: Homicide squad investigates after man's body found in NSW park

image.altText: Janine Vaughan smiling and wearing a dress.

props.synopsis: With more than 200,000 people expected to attend this weekend's Bathurst 1000, the family of Janine Vaughan wants a billboard raising awareness about her disappearance uncovered.

title.children: Family of missing woman hopes Bathurst 1000 can uncover answers
